select_device_info_text: Your device is not in the list? Add it to the <0>sensorWiki</0> to use it on the openSenseMap.
general_text: Please submit additional information about your device.
general_info_text: This information will be displayed publicly so be careful what you share. You can change this information later on.
exposure_explaination: This is how your device is exposed/placed.
select_sensors_text: Select the sensors you want to use by clicking on the cards. You can add the same sensor multiple times.
title: Title
advanced_text: Advanced connectivity settings for your device. You can only choose one option.
ttn_info_text: The openSenseMap offers an integration with <0>TheThingsNetwork</0>. Documentation for the parameters is provided on <1>GitHub</1>
ttn_app_id_info: The application ID recieved from TTN
ttn_dev_id_info: The device ID recieved from TTN
ttn_decode_profile_info: A decoding profile matching the payload format. For details and configuration see <0>here</0>.
ttn_decode_options_info: A JSON Array containing decoder configuration, needed for some profiles.
ttn_port_info: The TTN port to listen for messages. Optional, if not provided, all ports are used.
mqtt_info_text: The openSenseMap offers a <0>MQTT</0> client for connecting to public brokers. Documentation for the parameters is provided <1>here</1>. Please note that it's only possible to receive measurements through MQTT.
mqtt_url_info: The URL to the MQTT server.
mqtt_topic_info: The MQTT topic to subscribe to.
mqtt_message_format_info: The format the MQTT messages are in.
mqtt_decode_options_info: A json encoded string with options for decoding the message. `jsonPath` for `json`.
mqtt_connect_options_info: A json encoded string with options to supply to the MQTT client
location_text: Click on the map to choose a location for your device. You can also enter your coordinates manually or use the geosearch.
height_info_text: Height above sea level of your selected location in meters. If you have set up your device above ground level (e.g. high building), you should add this to the derived height. The height is espacially important if you have connected a sensor that meassures air pressure to make this meassurements compareable.
summary_text: Please check if everything is setup correctly.
